DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: COELHO, C. A. S.;COELHO, CAIO A. S.;COELHO, CAIO;COELHO, CAIO AUGUSTO DOS SANTOS;Coelho, C. A. S.;Coelho, CAS;COELHO, CAIO A S;COELHO, CAIO AS

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao (1998) e mestrado (2001) em Meteorologia pela Universidade de So Paulo, e doutorado (2005) e ps-doutorado (2006) em Meteorologia (Climatologia Estatstica) pela Universidade de Reading, Inglaterra. membro do grupo de pesquisa em verificao de previses de tempo e clima, membro do time de especialistas em previso extendida e de longo prazo (previso climtica sazonal), membro do Grupo de trabalho de climatologia da Associao regional III (Amrica do Sul), e tambm membro do Grupo de especialista da em centros regionais de clima (RCCs), todos quatro grupos da Organizao Meteorolgica Mundial (OMM). docente do curso de ps-graduao em Meteorologia do CPTEC/INPE. Tambm um dos editores da rea de climatologia da Revista Brasileira de Meteorologia (RBMET), da sociedade Brasileira de Meteorologia, e da Revista "Meteorological Applications" da sociedade real Britnica de meteorologia. Tem experincia na rea de Geocincias, com nfase em Climatologia, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Previses climticas sazonais, calibrao, combinao e verificao objetiva de previses climticas, modelos empricos (estatsticos) de previso climtica, 'downscaling' estattico, anlises estatsticas de eventos climticos extremos e estudos da relao entre a temperatura da superfcie do mar dos oceanos com varivies climticas sobre a Amrica do Sul.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Meteorologia Bacharelado from Universidade de So Paulo (1998), master's at Meteorology from Universidade de So Paulo (2001) and doctorate at Meteorologia from University of Reading (2005). Has experience in Geosciences, focusing on Climatology, acting on the following subjects: el nio oscilao sul, impacto da tsm sobre a precipitao, tcnicas estatsticas multivariadas, el nio southern oscilation and anomalias de circulao atmosfrica.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Aprovado em primeiro lugar em concurso pblico no ano de 2009 para o cargo de professor de Climatologia do curso de Graduao em Cincias Atmosfricas da Universidade Federal de Itajub.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: EUROBRISA: A EURO-BRazilian Initiative for improving South American seasonal forecasts
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A multi-institutional collaboration project involving the Centre for Weather Prediction and Climate Studies (CPTEC - Brazil), the Brazilian National Institute of Meteorology (INMET), the University of So Paulo (USP - Brazil), the Paran State Meteorological Institute of Technology (SIMEPAR - Brazil), the European Centre for Medium-Range and Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), the United Kingdom Met Office (Met Office), the Centre National of Recherches Mtorologiques (Mto-France) and the University of Reading (UoR - United Kingdom). This project will allow these eight institutions to exchange global seasonal forecast information with the aim of producing improved and well-calibrated real-time probabilistic seasonal forecasts for South America. The aims of this project are: a) Strengthen collaboration and promote exchange of expertise and information between European and South American seasonal forecasters; b) Produce improved well-calibrated real-time probabilistic seasonal forecasts for South America; and c) Develop real-time forecast products for non-profitable governmental use (e.g. reservoir management, hydropower production, and agriculture).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: A multi-institutional collaboration project involving the Centre for Weather Prediction and Climate Studies (CPTEC - Brazil), the Brazilian National Institute of Meteorology (INMET), the University of So Paulo (USP - Brazil), the Paran State Meteorological Institute of Technology (SIMEPAR - Brazil), the European Centre for Medium-Range and Weather Forecasts (ECMWF), the United Kingdom Met Office (Met Office), the Centre National of Recherches Mtorologiques (Mto-France) and the University of Reading (UoR - United Kingdom). This project will allow these eight institutions to exchange global seasonal forecast information with the aim of producing improved and well-calibrated real-time probabilistic seasonal forecasts for South America. The aims of this project are: a) Strengthen collaboration and promote exchange of expertise and information between European and South American seasonal forecasters; b) Produce improved well-calibrated real-time probabilistic seasonal forecasts for South America; and c) Develop real-time forecast products for non-profitable governmental use (e.g. reservoir management, hydropower production, and agriculture).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CLARIS LPB:A Europe-South America Network for Climate Change Assessment and Impact Studies in La Plata Basin
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The CLARIS LPB Project aims at predicting the regional climate change impacts on La Plata Basin (LPB) in South America, and at designing adaptation strategies for land-use, agriculture, rural development, hydropower production, river transportation, water resources and ecological systems in wetlands.
In order to reach such a goal, the project has been built on the following four major thrusts. First, improving the description and understanding of decadal climate variability is of prime importance for short-term regional climate change projections (2010-2040). Second, a sound approach requires an ensemble of coordinated regional climate scenarios in order to quantify the amplitude and sources of uncertainties in LPB future climate at two time horizons: 2010-2040 for adaptation strategies and 2070-2100 for assessment of long-range impacts. Such coordination will allow to critically improve the prediction capacity of climate change and its impacts in the region. Third, adaptation strategies to regional scenarios of climate change impacts require a multi-disciplinary approach where all the regional components (climate, hydrology, land use, land cover, agriculture and deforestation) are addressed in a collaborative way. Feedbacks between the regional climate groups and the land use and hydrology groups will ensure to draw a first-order feedback of future land use and hydrology scenarios onto the future regional climate change. Fourth, stakeholders must be integrated in the design of adaptation strategies, ensuring their dissemination to public, private and governmental policy-makers.
Finally, in continuity with the FP6 CLARIS Project, our project will put a special emphasis in forming young scientists and in strengthening the collaborations between European and South American partners.
The project is coordinated with the objectives of LPB, an international project on La Plata Basin that has been endorsed by the CLIVAR and GEWEX Panels.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelagem e previso sazonal do risco de doenas de plantas em larga escala - caso da ferrugem asitica da soja no Brasil
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Os objetivos do projeto so: 1) desenvolver modelos de disperso espacial e evoluo temporal do risco da ferrugem asitica da soja na escala local e regional, estudando a natureza hierrquica da disperso da doena e levando em conta a incerteza e a variabilidade nos parmetros de modelos climticos; 2) Avaliar o impacto da variabilidade climtica e identificar fatores chaves para o zoneamento de risco de epidemias e danos na produtividade da soja e 3) Avaliar o potencial de uso de previses climticas de curto a mdio prazo (at 30 dias), como variveis de entrada nos modelos preditivos de ferrugem da soja em larga escala para o Brasil.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Os objetivos do projeto so: 1) desenvolver modelos de disperso espacial e evoluo temporal do risco da ferrugem asitica da soja na escala local e regional, estudando a natureza hierrquica da disperso da doena e levando em conta a incerteza e a variabilidade nos parmetros de modelos climticos; 2) Avaliar o impacto da variabilidade climtica e identificar fatores chaves para o zoneamento de risco de epidemias e danos na produtividade da soja e 3) Avaliar o potencial de uso de previses climticas de curto a mdio prazo (at 30 dias), como variveis de entrada nos modelos preditivos de ferrugem da soja em larga escala para o Brasil.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Modelagem e previso sazonal do risco de doenas de plantas em larga escala - caso da ferrugem asitica da soja no Brasil

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: EU-funded project entitled "A Europe-South America network for climate change assessment and impact studies?. The overall objective of the project is to strengthen collaboration between research groups in Europe and South America to develop common research strategies on climate change and impact issues in the subtropical region of South America through a multi-scale integrated approach (continental-regional-local).
